image.altText: The scene of the car crash on Canberra Avenue near Burke Crescent in Griffith.

props.synopsis: Two school students are in hospital with severe injuries after a car crash in Griffith this morning.

title.children: Two school students hospitalised after car crashes in Canberra's south

image.altText: The front of Bimberi youth detention centre .

props.synopsis: Police confirm they are investigating allegations a detainee was assaulted by an employee at Bimberi Youth Justice Centre in Canberra, which the Commissioner for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Children says she was recently refused access to.

title.children: Detainee allegedly assaulted by staff member at Bimberi Youth Justice Centre

image.altText: Three taxidermied birds on a metal slab.

props.synopsis: It's part of a collection including 99 per cent of Australia's native birds as well as exotic bird species, skeletons, mammals, reptiles stored in ethanol, eggs and frozen tissue.

title.children: 'Small piece in a really big jigsaw': Penguin frozen in time finds home

image.altText: A crowd safety officer looks over the crowd at Summernats 2024 in Canberra.

props.synopsis: Two security guards who punched patrons in a brawl at Summernats have escaped jail time, with a judge labelling the situation as "highly volatile".

title.children: Summernats guards avoid jail after punching patrons in festival brawl

image.altText: Six different hands reach towards a contactless pay point on public transport, each paying in a different way.

props.synopsis: An inquiry into Canberra's troubled MyWay+ ticketing system has been told the personal details of public transport users were likely accessible on the internet before and after its launch.

title.children: Inquiry into botched MyWay+ rollout hears personal details were accessible online

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: A former public servant accused of paying a young relative hundreds of dollars to send him indecent images of herself has been denied bail in the ACT Magistrates Court.

title.children: Canberra court hears man coerced young relative to send indecent images

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: A Canberra man and woman are banned from owning a pet for 10 years after pleading guilty to animal cruelty.

title.children: Canberra pair banned from owning a pet after emaciated dog put down

image.altText: A top-down view of University House at the Australian National University after remediation works.

props.synopsis: Like all ambitious rebuilds, it comes complete with drama, delay, cost overruns and the grit to persevere through to completion.

title.children: 'Feels like a metaphor': ANU on deadline to complete restoration after hailstorm

image.altText: A view of a bay of turquoise and darker blue water, and a white sand beach.

props.synopsis: New figures suggest last year's turmoil dealt a severe blow to New Caledonia's population, as French nationals left the territory in search of jobs or to escape violence.

title.children: 'Everything collapsed': Why thousands have left a Pacific paradise

image.altText: A close-up shot of a voter's hand dropping a ballot paper into a purple ballot box at a polling booth.

props.synopsis: With marginal seats everywhere and a range of third party challenges, there are plenty of storylines to watch.

title.children: In an election where anything can happen, these seats matter most

image.altText: A collage of political images, badges and merch in different colours

props.synopsis: The date is set, and here’s your cheat sheet to the 2025 Australian federal election.

title.children: The election has been called. What happens now?

image.altText: A giant flame roars from gas flare stack, silhouetted against the dusk sky

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton vows to "immediately" force gas giants to set aside for domestic use as much as 20 per cent of supply that would "otherwise be exported", cutting wholesale prices by 40 per cent.

title.children: Dutton promises lower energy prices with plan to tap gas exports

image.altText: Older man in a suit wearing a a suit and waving

props.synopsis: King Charles is forced to cancel public engagements after being taken to hospital due to side-effects from his ongoing cancer treatment, Buckingham Palace says.

title.children: Palace says king was hospitalised with cancer treatment side-effects

image.altText: An ariel view of township of Jundah flooding.

props.synopsis: Outback Queensland residents say the floodwater has reached "unprecedented" levels, with many forced to evacuate their homes and leave stock to fend for themselves.

title.children: Outback flood tops 1974 levels, towns evacuate amid major stock loss fears

image.altText: A person walks across a concreted area in the foreground. Behind them is Greenland's capital Nuuk.

props.synopsis: The Russian president says he worries NATO countries could use the Arctic as a "springboard for future conflicts".

title.children: US plan to take over Greenland 'serious', Putin says

image.altText: A man speaking. In this picture, only his face is visible.

props.synopsis: Ukraine's leader accuses the US of "constantly changing" a minerals deal linked to military aid, as cracks in the already fractured relationship between Kyiv and Washington widened on Thursday.

title.children: Zelenskyy accuses US of 'constantly changing' minerals deal

image.altText: a backpacker standing next to a car.

props.synopsis: A stoush has broken out between working tourists and residents of an upmarket part of Albany, southern WA, over public facilities at one of the city's most popular beaches.

title.children: Council launches fines blitz on travellers 'hogging' public facilities

image.altText: ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 regains ground, given a boost by gold stocks. Meanwhile, analysts expect the election to have a "limited" impact on markets. Follow live.

title.children: ASX regains ground, election tipped to have 'limited' impact on markets

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Rates likely to stay on hold as May 3 election called: RBC
ASX higher at lunch with gold stocks surging
What does the election mean for markets?

image.altText: Red fireworks over the Beijing Olympic stadium

props.synopsis: Brisbane has put its cards down on the table for its showpiece stadiums ahead of the 2032 Olympics. But how do the planned venues stack up against previous Games?

title.children: How Brisbane's planned stadiums stack up against previous Games

image.altText: Stuart Hume

props.synopsis: As another Aboriginal family says goodbye to their brother who died in custody, legal and health experts are frustrated that efforts to minimise hanging points in jail cells are 'painfully slow'.

title.children: Stuart's family say he asked for help but didn't get it. Days later he was dead

image.altText: A young man with a bear and afro wearing sunglasses looks at a phone camera.

props.synopsis: The brother of slain underworld figure Hamad 'the executioner' Assaad has won a court battle with his family over the sale of a home in Sydney's west.

title.children: Family of slain infamous underworld figure entangled in property dispute

image.altText: Jacqui sits on an interview couch in a still from Married at First Sight.

props.synopsis: This is how reality TV editors make a new sentence from individual words, according to an editor and a former contestant.

title.children: Can reality TV shows fake people's words? We ask the experts

image.altText: Flock of chickens in a pen.

props.synopsis: The egg shortage is considered a possible motive after chickens were plucked from a flock of birds at a Hobart school.

title.children: Egg shortage possible motive after chooks stolen from school

image.altText: Aerial view of cracked light brown clay with a bright green soy plant growing out of a crack in the middle.

props.synopsis: Soil moisture has declined more than 2,600 gigatonnes since 2000, making a greater contribution to sea level rise than Greenland's melting ice sheets.

title.children: Earth has lost more than '4,000 Sydney Harbours' of fresh water

image.altText: Christian Horner, team principal of Red Bull Racing, looking over at driver Liam Lawson, who is looking at a screen

props.synopsis: Liam Lawson has suffered one of the more ruthless axings in Formula 1, and his replacement will need to overcome a temperamental car and a dysfunctional team or be at risk of a similar fate.

title.children: Lawson's F1 axing makes him a scapegoat for wider problems at Red Bull

image.altText: Flinders Ranges in South Australia

props.synopsis: Native title holders in South Australia's Flinders Ranges win the right to access financial records showing how tens of millions of dollars in mining royalties have been spent, after the state's Supreme Court upheld an earlier ruling.

title.children: Native title holders win right to see records of mining millions

image.altText: An aerial photo of proposed stadium site at Victoria Park with annotations of important locations in the area.

props.synopsis: It's been three days since venue plans for the 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games were revealed, but real estate agents are already spruiking the benefits of buying within what some of them are calling the "Olympic epicentre".

title.children: Some Brisbane suburbs to see 'guaranteed demand' from Olympics plan

image.altText: Peter Dutton smiles during QT.

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton has delivered his response to the government's budget and it's big on petrol and gas, with barely a word on nuclear.

title.children: Dutton's latest barrage in Coalition's 25-year war with itself on fuel excise

image.altText: Patient in hospital bed has their hand held.

props.synopsis: Doctors often prescribe strong medications to relieve pain, distress and discomfort in palliative care, but many of these drugs have recently been unavailable or difficult to access.

title.children: 'A basic human right': Pain drug shortages cause problems in palliative care

image.altText: A white man with sandy-coloured curly hair wearing a black t-shirt holds a smartphone in his palm

props.synopsis: Tech giant Meta used millions of pirated books by Australian authors including Hannah Kent, Charlotte Wood and Tim Winton to train its AI language model.

title.children: High-profile Australian authors furious at Meta's AI 'plundering' their work

image.altText: The outside of the Nine Entertainment headquarters in North Sydney.

props.synopsis: The data of 16,000 readers of the Sydney Morning Herald, The Age and The Financial Review is exposed online following a major cyber security breach

title.children: Nine newspapers subscribers have data exposed online in breach

image.altText: Organised crime figure Alvin Chau

props.synopsis: The Queensland government has released a report that upholds the ABC's revelation that a Brisbane casino owner had a "concealed relationship" with a jailed junket boss.

title.children: Government report backed ABC revelation of casino owner's hidden ties

image.altText: NSW Police car up grass embankment

props.synopsis: An e-bike rider has been killed after he and a police car collided at Waterloo in Sydney's inner-south, with a significant amount of drugs and cash found.

title.children: Man killed in e-bike collision with police car in Sydney

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman with grey hair is wearing red cat-eye glasses, a white t shirt and quandong seed necklace looks off camera.

props.synopsis: After 40 years in storage, archival materials are helping share the story of the "groundbreaking" first Aboriginal Women's Art Festival. One elder says it broke down barriers for First Nations women and put their art in focus like never before.

title.children: Archival materials shining a light on 'groundbreaking' arts event

image.altText: Jacob Elordi with a moustache and checked shirt holds an older style video camera while standing in a field

props.synopsis: It's been another big week in news, so it's time to test yourself.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A group chat, a Senate prop and Jacob Elordi plays a heart-throb
